benchmark_details.name: KITAB-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: KITAB-Bench is a comprehensive Arabic OCR benchmark that spans 9 major domains and 36 sub-domains, providing diverse document types for evaluation such as handwritten text, structured tables, and charts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of KITAB-Bench is to provide a standardized evaluation framework for Arabic OCR systems to enhance their performance and benchmark capabilities.

data.source: KITAB-Bench dataset consists of curated samples from existing Arabic document datasets, manually annotated PDFs, and synthetically generated content using an LLM-assisted pipeline.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by native Arabic speakers

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated using standard evaluation formulas, such as Levenshtein distance for CER and WER, precision and recall for layout detection, and others.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in OCR tasks and a more accurate extraction of information.
methodology.validation: Validated by native Arabic speakers through rigorous review.
